title: 103_hr3300
content: The Act titled "Natural Resource Management on Military Lands Act of 1994" amends the Sikes Act to promote wildlife conservation on military reservations. It requires integrated natural resource management plans for military installations. The Sikes Act is amended to require the Secretary to prepare and implement integrated natural resource management plans for each military installation in the United States, with an exception for installations where the Secretary deems such a plan inappropriate. The Sikes Act is amended to require the Secretary to prepare integrated natural resource management plans for military installations in the US, with exceptions for installations where such a plan is deemed inappropriate. Amendments include changing references from "cooperative plan" to "integrated natural resource management plan." The Sikes Act is amended to require integrated natural resource management plans for military installations in the US, changing references from "cooperative plan" to "integrated natural resource management plan" in various sections. The Sikes Act is amended to require integrated natural resource management plans for military installations in the US, changing references from "cooperative plan" to "integrated natural resource management plan" in various sections, including section 103 and section 106. The contents of the plans are also amended in section 101(b). The Sikes Act is amended to require integrated natural resource management plans for military installations in the US. This includes wetland protection and restoration, consideration of conservation needs for biological communities, and the establishment of specific natural resource management goals and objectives. The Sikes Act is amended to require integrated natural resource management plans for military installations in the US. The plans must address fish and wildlife management, land management, forest management, and wildlife-oriented recreation, ensure consistency among activities, prevent a net loss in land capability for military missions, and allow sustained public use of natural resources. The Sikes Act amendment mandates integrated natural resource management plans for military installations in the US. These plans must ensure land capability for military missions, allow public use of natural resources, provide necessary access, and enforce natural resource laws. The Sikes Act amendment requires integrated natural resource management plans for military installations, including public comment opportunities on the plans. SEC. 4. REVIEW OF MILITARY INSTALLATIONS FOR INTEGRATED NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT PLANS. The Secretary of each military department must review all military installations in the United States to determine which ones require an integrated natural resource management plan. A report on these determinations must be submitted to the Secretary of Defense, who will then report to Congress within 12 months. The Secretary of Defense must report to Congress within 12 months on the reviews of military installations for integrated natural resource management plans. Within 2 years of the report, plans must be prepared for selected installations. The Secretary of Defense must report to Congress within 12 months on reviews of military installations for integrated natural resource management plans. Within 2 years of the report, plans must be prepared for selected installations where deemed appropriate. The Secretary of Defense must complete negotiations with the Secretary of the Interior and State agencies for changes to cooperative plans for military installations to comply with integrated natural resource management plans. Public comments are allowed for proposed plans and changes to cooperative plans. SEC. 5. ANNUAL REVIEWS AND REPORTS. Section 101 (16 U.S.C. 670a) is amended to include subsection (g) which requires the Secretary of Defense to review and report on the implementation of integrated natural resource management plans annually by March 1. The report must include the number of plans in effect, expenditure on conservation efforts, and other relevant details. The report must include the number of management plans in effect, the amount of money spent on conservation activities, and an assessment of plan compliance with requirements. The Secretary of the Interior must submit an annual report on conservation expenditures and activities conducted under integrated natural resource management plans in consultation with State agencies responsible for conservation. The Secretary of the Interior must submit an annual report on conservation activities conducted under integrated natural resource management plans in consultation with State agencies and defined committees in the House of Representatives and Senate. SEC. 6. FEDERAL ENFORCEMENT OF INTEGRATED NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT PLANS; ENFORCEMENT OF OTHER LAWS. Title I (16 U.S.C. 670a et seq.) is amended to allow the Secretary of Defense to enforce Federal laws related to conservation on military installations within the United States. SEC. 7. NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT SERVICES. Title I (16 U.S.C. 670a et seq.) is further amended to include provisions for natural resource management services. SEC. 7. NATURAL RESOURCE MANAGEMENT SERVICES. The Secretary of each military department must ensure trained personnel for natural resource management and law enforcement to comply with the Act. SEC. 8. DEFINITIONS. Definitions related to natural resource management are further clarified in Title I. In this title, "military department" refers to the Army, Navy, and Air Force. "Military installation" includes land owned by the US and managed by the Secretary of Defense or a military department. "State fish and wildlife agency" is a state government agency responsible for managing fish and wildlife resources. The term 'State fish and wildlife agency' refers to a state government agency responsible for managing fish or wildlife resources in the United States, including the States, the District of Columbia, the Commonwealth of Puerto Rico, and the territories and possessions of the United States. SEC. 9. SHORT TITLE. Title I (16 U.S.C. 670a et seq.) is further amended by inserting after section 108 the following: "SEC. 109. SHORT TITLE. This title may be cited as the 'Sikes Act'." SEC. 10. COOPERATIVE AGREEMENTS. Cost Sharing.--Section 103a(b) is amended by replacing "matching basis" with "cost-sharing basis". Accounting.--Section 103a(c) is amended to exclude section 1535 of that title. SEC. 11. REPEAL. Section 2 of the Act of October 27, 1986 is repealed. SEC. 12. CLERICAL AMENDMENTS. Title I, as amended by this Act, is further amended to replace "military reservations" with "military installations" in various sections. In Title I, "military reservations" are replaced with "military installations" in different sections, including section 101(c), section 102, and section 103 of the Act. SEC. 13. AUTHORIZATIONS OF APPROPRIATIONS. Amends sections related to programs on military installations and public lands by updating the years for authorizations of appropriations to 1994, 1995, 1996, and 1997.
